com.illcode.meterman

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    An instance of a particular game.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void about()
      Called when the user selects "About..." in the UI
      void debugCommand(String command)
      The UI provides a facility for the implementor to enter debug commands, which will be passed along to the game using this method.
      void dispose()
      Free any allocated resources, other than images and sounds, which will be freed automatically.
      WorldState getInitialWorldState()
      Generate the world state to be used at the start of the game.
      String getName()
      The name of the game, as displayed in the "New Game" UI.
      void init()
      Called when a game is started or loaded.
      void start(boolean newGame)
      Called when the GameManager has set up the world model, either by calling getInitialWorldState() or by restoring a saved WorldState, and is ready to being the game.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the game, as displayed in the "New Game" UI. It must match the name given in the game's .glue file.

      • init

        void init()
        Called when a game is started or loaded. A game should, in this method, load any resources (images, sound, bundles) it wants immediately or game-globally available.

        It should also install any game-specific action translations and set the game bundle.

        See Also:
        Utils.installActionNameTranslations(Path), Meterman.setGameBundle(TextBundle)

      • about

        void about()
        Called when the user selects "About..." in the UI

      • getInitialWorldState

        WorldState getInitialWorldState()
        Generate the world state to be used at the start of the game. This includes registering any listeners and processors with the GameManager that should be active when play begins.

        Remember that the player character's current room must be set appropriately.

        The general order of things in the typical implementation of this method is
        1. Create all rooms and entities
        2. Connect rooms and add entities
        3. Register managers, listeners, and delegates, passing as parameters references to the particular objects they need to work with.
        See Also:
        WorldBuilder

      • start

        void start(boolean newGame)
        Called when the GameManager has set up the world model, either by calling getInitialWorldState() or by restoring a saved WorldState, and is ready to being the game.
        Parameters:
        newGame - true if this is a new game; false if the game has been loaded

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Free any allocated resources, other than images and sounds, which will be freed automatically. Called when the GameManager is unloading the current game instance.

      • debugCommand

        void debugCommand(String command)
        The UI provides a facility for the implementor to enter debug commands, which will be passed along to the game using this method. These commands can be used to, for instance, jump to a later part of the game, move entities around, etc.
        Parameters:
        command - debug command
